summary: The "group of leading industrialized countries" refers to a collective of economically advanced nations that play a pivotal role in global governance and economic policy-making. In the context of EU legal and regulatory frameworks, this group often engages in discussions that influence trade agreements, environmental standards, and international cooperation. The EU, as a significant member of this group, aligns its regulatory strategies with the objectives set forth by these leading nations. This concept serves as a redirect to the preferred term, emphasizing its importance in shaping EU policies and fostering collaboration among industrialized economies.
